data.title: So convienent!
data.text: I loved the location of our hotel! Collins avenue is where you need to be! All the major places to eat at are on Collins!

data.title: Yacht and luxury buildings
data.text: Yachts, luxury buildings but also lower standard. Many shops and restaurants. The street is soooo long, so bike option is good idea.

data.title: Many hotels and restaurants near here
data.text: There are a lot of restaurants and hotels near the area. A lot to see and experience here. Walk around and see for yourself.

data.title: Many restaurants and hotels
data.text: While not right on the beach, there are restaurants and hotels. It is not as busy as Ocean Drive and can make a good alternate when walking.

data.title: Shelborne Wyndham Grand Hotel at 1801 Collins Ave.
data.text: Collins Ave is the place to be in Miami Beach.  We booked three nights at the Shelborne and were very impressed when we walked into the lobby.  The guest room was large,but...we later found the glass shower door was just about ready to fall off the tile wall.  It wouldn't shut all the way and the floor got flooded.  We reported it the next morning and were moved to another room.  That shower door worked just fine, but the lamp by the bed would not turn on.  Got that fixed the next day.  By now we were just about ready to go home so did not find/complain about anything else.   It is a great location and we probably will stay here again someday....only we will inspect the room before we unpack!

data.title: Convenient area
data.text: This is area that has everything you need in walking distance behind Beach area From Walgreens to Restaurants thats affordable.

data.title: Strolling Collins Avenue
data.text: Love ALL the sights and sounds of walking Collins Avenue. The restaurants are ready to provide some of the best drinks ANYWHERE! The seagulls, the music, the coconut oil....

data.title: Nice street
data.text: Collins avenue is a long avenue with beautifull art deco hotels! Looking for a good place to stay, this is the place to go to!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text:
If you can stay here do it! What a great experience! Classic buildings, amazing little food gems and the occasional cheesy tshirt shop! 
You can get everything from a slice of pizza to a gourmet one if a kind experience. Loved it!

data.title: The artery of Miami Beach
data.text: The street have all kinds of persons and activities, is the artery cultural, social of Miami Beach, the top fashion is here, in the street you see the diversity of Miami, all languages, all people of the world

data.title: Birthday weekend
data.text: Beautiful eye catching structures and the luxurious side of hotel living. Upscale boutiques and restaurants within walking distance. Also Uber or Lyft friendly. I would definitely recommend this to others.

data.title: Lots of Shops
data.text: We enjoyed walking up and down Collins Avenue. Lots of shops, restaurants, and people watching.  Everything you need is there pizza place, Walgreens, liquor stores and the usual tourist tacky shops. Make a point of checking it out.

data.title: Girls trip
data.text: This entire strip has some good stores, and restaurants... Everything is walking distance.. Liquor store Walgreens CVS clothing store and bars

data.title: Collins is HOT!
data.text: There's a plethora of activity all day everyday. You have tourist activities,hotels and local commerce. We stayed on Collins at the Lowes and it never disappoints!

data.title: Holiday
data.text: Stayed at Marseille hotel on Collins ave, very good place to stay and very reasonably priced. Centrally located in south beach within walking distance of all attractions, restaurants and on the beach.

data.title: Great location
data.text: Hotels from one end to the next, lots of shops to shop at and restaurants. They have places to get rent bikes

data.title: Scenic
data.text: We drove up and down Collins Ave for an hour or so. It is hard to find parking but there are so many nice hotels and the architecture is great. There are many places to eat and shop so you can't  get bored but you will have to find a parking spot a few blocks away. It is also easy access to the beach from 11th Street.

data.title: Walk
data.text: Took a long walk from 63rd to 14th Street. Tired. But I must admit I saw some things I never saw before. I had a good time. Plenty of tattoo shops, local places to eat, plenty of ppl to see.

data.title: More construction than anything else
data.text: It was the third time we went to South Beach and we had high expectations. Shopping, beach and having a nice drink was on the program. Well, the weather was extraordinary bad. However, we experienced that every second shop is empty and heavy construction is going on all over the place. That applies for Colin's and for Washington. The only almost proper street is Lincoln. When it's finished it will be awesome, but right now it is awful. We would not go there for the next year or two before it gets fancy again.

data.title: Nice restaurants
data.text: It's a big avenue only a block away from the ocean. Nice restaurants and wide sidewalks, quite busy but perfect location!
